channel.title: Debian halp
channel.description:
k so I installed debian with gnome and the wireless internet wont work. I used the gnome network tool to add my wireless connection but it wouldn't save the connection and connect with it. Then I installed wireless-tools, the ralink driver, and wpa-supplicant but that still didnt make the network tool work.
So my question is: On a new install of debian, how do you get wireless internet to work?

item.title: Debian halp
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Except that the rt2x00 are in the base kernel iirc and therefore are on every distro

item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:7, topic:289591”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=382790.msg2874463#msg2874463 date=1247965742]
Why debian+gnome? Surely you could have just installed Ubuntu?

Post Wireless card etc.
[/quote]

ubuntu is not debian + gnome. its “debian” + gnome + a bunch of other useless shit[/quote]
useless shit like wifi drivers that Just Work.

Read full topic
